intro: Galium chapi, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, typically in late spring to early summer. Galium chapi is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream sides.
